intro: Antiphiona, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, while its stems are hairy and branching. Antiphiona is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
